summary: The provided documents do not directly mention G. Robert Blakey. However, they pertain to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. While Blakey is not explicitly named in these documents, the documents relate to the financial and administrative aspects of the HSCA, the committee he served as chief counsel and staff director. The documents include payroll records, authorization forms, and related correspondence for various HSCA staff members, such as I. Charles Mathews, William Brown, Dominick K. Giangrasso, Charles Michael Berk, and Jan Richard Schlichtmann. These records cover details like salary adjustments, employment verification, appointments, resignations, and certifications of non-relationship to members of Congress. The Assassination Records Review Board also issued final determination notifications regarding the release status of these records, particularly concerning the postponement of social security numbers to protect personal privacy.
significance: G. Robert Blakey was the chief counsel and staff director for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). While not directly mentioned in the provided documents, the documents relate to the HSCA staff payroll records, which are administrative records of the committee he led during its investigation into the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his leadership role within the HSCA, overseeing the investigation and its staff.
